name: Lead_Value_Analytics_tp
label: Lead Value Analytics
description: Take a business, KPI-led view of how your Service users interact with your customer data.  Understand what components on the page are used by high-productivity users, and what unused components may be beneficial to users who are still learning.

title.label: What is the sequence of clicks on page components?
title.subtitleLabel: How long does it take to complete the next action?

title.label: When and Where do users navigate about the app?
What is the last component a user interacts with before leaving their session?
Where and When do users typically end their session?

LatestDate_1.label: LatestDate

richTextContent.insert: Select one or more components from the bar-chart above to see how interactions with that component have changed over time.

The source object refers to users working in a console-type app, in which navigations to child records contains a URL that includes the initial record Id and object name, which is given the label 'Source Object'.  It should be considered as the entry point at which a user starts interacting with a customer record.

The vast majority of users will perform the same interactions on every page. On Cases, they will view the case feed, click on specific notes to read the details, or add new notes to the case. Components like FeedPosts and FeedTabTitle makes sense.
Any component that is high on the list suggests that it is useful to users, and so it should be positioned more prominently on the page.
However, if users are interacting with components too frequently or unnecessarily, it suggests additional training or coaching is needed.
Click on the chart headers (Clicks, Related Cases, Clicks Per Case) to change the sorting.
Want to know more about what each component is? Visit the:

The Page is derived from the event logs, and can be anything from an Account, Contact, custom object, or even the Home, Setup and Community pages. Knowing what object are viewed in the context of an App is important: are Sales Console users spending a lot of time in Cases? Are Service Consoles users spending a lot of time looking at Billing Records?

All Salesforce Lightning pages are made up of 'components'. Examples of components are: Save Button, Quick Action, Detail Tab, a Related List, the drop-down arrow on top of a Related List. Some component names can be quite technical and hard to understand. In this case, considering updating the Lightning Data Dictionary to give a clearer understanding.
How does user behaviour correlate with performance?

The leads in scope of this dashboard are all records that have been modified within the last 30 days.  The chart on the left should show top lead owners, an average data quality score, and who is interacting with their leads.  The chart on the right shows the total time and frequency of interactions in the context of the account size (annual revenue).

content.description: Each bubble represents the sum of measures for leads owned by [Owner.Name] The total time to complete actions on their leads was [sum_Interactions.SUMTimeToAction], over a total of [sum_Interactions.TotalClicks] clicks. This effort was spread over a combined lead age of [sum_Age] days, over [sum_Interactions.UniqueSessionKey] sessions involving [sum_Interactions.UniqueUserCount] users. The total time to complete these actions was [sum_Interactions.SumStallTime] and produced a data quality score of [avg_DataQualityScore]. All of this relates to leads with a predicted annual revenue of [sum_AnnualRevenue].
